context.description: Use this window to either add a new MIME type with a new extension, or to change the MIME type or extension for an existing MIME type.
The name of the MIME type. A MIME is a type of resource that the browser uses to determine how to display the information.
The extension of the MIME type.
This wizard allows you to add a Web module to this server configuration. This wizard appears if you had clicked Add Web Module on the Modules page of the Tomcat Server Configuration Editor.
List of available Web modules for this Tomcat server configuration.
The Tomcat path which specifies the module's URL. Typically, this might be the name of the project.
Specifies the path where the Web module is located.
Specifies whether to pick up the changes made to the module while the server is running.
This wizard allows you to add a Web module for this server configuration. This wizard appears if you had clicked Add Web module on the Modules page of the Tomcat Server Configuration Editor.
This editor allows you to edit Tomcat server configuration files. To move between the pages, click on the tabs that are located at the bottom of the Tomcat Configuration Editor.
List of available MIME types and the extensions that it maps to for a specific server configuration. For example: text, image, or application.

Add, change, and remove a MIME type and extension. To add a MIME type with a new extension to the MIME Types list, click Add. The Add MIME Mapping window opens. To remove an existing MIME type with its extension from the MIME Types list, select the MIME type and then click Remove. The MIME type and its extension are no longer shown in the list. To change the name of the MIME type, or the extension of an existing MIME type shown in the MIME Types list, select the MIME type and then click Edit. The Edit MIME Mapping window opens.

Add, change, and remove a MIME type and extension. To add a MIME type with a new extension to the MIME Types list, click Add. The Add MIME Mapping window opens. To remove an existing MIME type with its extension from the MIME Types list, select the MIME type and then click Remove. The MIME type and its extension are no longer shown in the list. To change the name of the MIME type, or the extension of an existing MIME type shown in the MIME Types list, select the MIME type and then click Edit. The Edit MIME Mapping window opens.

Add, change, and remove a MIME type and extension. To add a MIME type with a new extension to the MIME Types list, click Add. The Add MIME Mapping window opens. To remove an existing MIME type with its extension from the MIME Types list, select the MIME type and then click Remove. The MIME type and its extension are no longer shown in the list. To change the name of the MIME type, or the extension of an existing MIME type shown in the MIME Types list, select the MIME type and then click Edit. The Edit MIME Mapping window opens.
This editor allows you to edit Tomcat server configuration files. To move between the pages, click on the tabs that are located at the bottom of the Tomcat Configuration Editor.
List of available ports used by Tomcat and their respective port numbers. To change an existing port number in the list, select the port number and type the new number over it.
This editor allows you to edit Tomcat server configuration files. To move between the pages, click on the tabs that are located at the bottom of the Tomcat Configuration Editor.
List of available Web modules for this Tomcat server configuration.
Adds a Web project to the list.
Adds a Web module located externally to the list.
Edits a Web module in the list. For example, you may want to disable the Auto reload function.
Remove a Web module from the list.
This editor allows you to edit Tomcat server files. To move between the pages, click on the tabs that are located at the bottom of the Tomcat Server Editor.
The name of the Tomcat server.
The directory where Apache Tomcat is installed. For example, d:\tomcat\jakarta-tomcat-3.2.3. You can either type the path of the directory or click Browse to select it.
The directory where Apache Tomcat is installed. For example, d:\tomcat\jakarta-tomcat-3.2.3. You can either type the path of the directory or click Browse to select it.

This wizard allows you to provide additional installation directory information required for using Apache Tomcat.
In the Name field, specify the name that you want to assign to your Tomcat Server.
In the Tomcat installation directory field, specify the directory where Apache Tomcat is installed. For example, d:\tomcat\jakarta-tomcat-3.2.3. You can either type the path of the directory or click Browse to select it.
Under JRE list, select an environment variable that specify where your JDK is installed. For example, Workbench default JRE. You can either select the appropriate value from the JRE list or click Installed JRE to define a new JRE environment variable.

This dialog prompts for confirmation to clean the work directory on a Tomcat server. The dialog will indicate if the entire work directory or the work directory for an individual module will be cleaned.
If the server is currently running, the server will be stopped prior to cleaning, and then restarted.
